content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})
    # Initialize an empty vector to store the filtered words
    names = Vector{String}()

    for word in words
        if occursin(' ', word) || (first(word) == uppercasefirst(word))
            push!(names, word)
        end
    end

    return names
end
```

This function checks if a word starts with an uppercase letter or contains a space. If it does, it is considered a "name" and is added to the `names` vector. The `occursin(' ', word)` check is used to include words that start with a space, which would also be considered as starting with an uppercase letter since spaces are not alphanumeric characters.
